job.title: Create Multisig Job (Standard)
job.desc: Standard workflow for productive multisig. Creates a job ID and collects distributed signatures.
job.short: Create a multisig job (Job-ID) and collect distributed signatures.

infoBody.one: The transaction is stored as a multisig job in the backend and is assigned a job ID. Nothing is sent directly.
infoBody.two: Alle nächsten Unterzeichner öffnen in ihrer SKM-Instanz den Menüpunkt „Multisig-Jobs“, laden den Job und unterschreiben.
infoBody.three: Once there are enough signatures (Threshold erreicht), the transaction is sent or can be sent.
infoBody.four: Du kannst die Job-ID an weitere Unterzeichner weitergeben oder sie wählen den Job direkt in „Multisig-Jobs“ aus.

steps.one: Step 1: A multisig job is created and receives a job ID.
steps.two: Schritt 2: Alle nächsten Unterzeichner öffnen in ihrer SKM-Instanz den Menüpunkt „Multisig-Jobs“, laden den Job und unterschreiben.
steps.three: Schritt 3: Der zweite Signer öffnet in seiner SKM-Instanz den Menüpunkt „Multisig-Jobs“, lädt den Job und unterschreibt.
steps.four: Step 4: Once enough signatures have been gathered, the transaction is sent or can be sent.

local.title: Enter all signatures locally & send directly.
local.desc: Only use if all secret keys can be securely entered on this device (Tests/Recovery/Admin).
local.warning: Warning: All secret keys will be collected during this session. Use only on trusted devices.

infoBody.one: You enter all the required secret keys on this device one after another until the threshold is reached.
infoBody.two: Das ist kein verteilter Multisig-Flow mehr, sondern „Multi-Key auf einem Gerät“ – nur auf vertrauenswürdigen Geräten nutzen.
infoBody.three: Once enough signatures are collected, the transaction is sent directly to Horizon (ohne Multisig-Job).

xdr.title: Export XDR (nicht senden)
xdr.desc: Generate a raw XDR transaction for offline tools or hardware wallets.
xdr.short: Export transaction as XDR without sending it directly.

infoBody.one: XDR is the raw transaction format of Stellar. Nothing is sent automatically.
infoBody.two: Use XDR for hardware wallets, offline computers, or other wallets/tools that can import XDR.
infoBody.three: You are responsible for signing and/or sending the XDR later yourself (e.g., through multisig jobs or an external tool).

steps.one: An XDR is generated, but nothing is sent.
steps.two: You can externally sign the XDR (Offline-Rechner, Hardware-Wallet, anderes Tool).
steps.three: To send, you need to re-import the XDR (e.g., via Multisig jobs or another tool) and then sign/send it there.

distributed.title: Standard: Distributed Multisig Flow
distributed.body: By default, this session only signs with your own secret key. Additional signatures are supplemented via exported XDR files or a job ID from other signers.

localAll.title: Enter all signatures locally
localAll.body: Select this option only if you control all the secret keys associated with this account (z. B. nach einer Kontorettung mit mehreren Unterzeichnern). The Stellar Account Manager will then collect all signatures locally and send the transaction directly to Horizon.
localAll.checkboxLabel: Enter all signatures locally in this dialog and send them directly.
